@graph.name: Thai Pumpkin Curry Vegan - Vegan Richa
@graph.description: Celebrate pumpkin season with this easy Thai Pumpkin Curry! Tender fresh pumpkin, tofu and veggies simmered in red curry coconut milk broth!

@graph.name: Thai Pumpkin Curry
@graph.description: Celebrate pumpkin season with this easy Thai Pumpkin Curry! Tender fresh pumpkin and tofu simmered along with vegetables in a spicy red curry coconut broth! The perfect vegan fall dinner! Gluten-free + Nutfree + soy-free option.Â
recipeIngredient: 2 cups  peeled and cubed pumpkin or you can also use kabocha squash,  (acorn, or butternut squash)
2 teaspoons lime juice or 3 or 4 Markut lime leaves
1 cup sliced bell pepper (I used a mix of green and red)
1/4 cup Thai basil and more for garnish
1 cup cubed firm or medium-firm tofu
lime juice , pepper flakes and Thai basil for garnish

recipeInstructions.text: Heat the oil over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook until the garlic is golden.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat the oil over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook until the garlic is golden.

recipeInstructions.text: Then add in your red curry paste, miso, soy sauce, and mushroom powder and mix well. The mix of miso soy sauce and powdered mushroom act as a substitute for fish sauce.
recipeInstructions.name: Then add in your red curry paste, miso, soy sauce, and mushroom powder and mix well. The mix of miso soy sauce and powdered mushroom act as a substitute for fish sauce.

recipeInstructions.text: Cook for a minute then add in your coconut milk. Mix the red curry paste in the coconut milk so that there are no lumps remaining.
recipeInstructions.name: Cook for a minute then add in your coconut milk. Mix the red curry paste in the coconut milk so that there are no lumps remaining.

recipeInstructions.text: Then add in the salt, pepper, pumpkin, lime juice, and mix well.
recipeInstructions.name: Then add in the salt, pepper, pumpkin, lime juice, and mix well.

recipeInstructions.text: Cover and cook until the pumpkin is al dente. It will take 8-10 minutes depending on the squash used and your stove, etc.
recipeInstructions.name: Cover and cook until the pumpkin is al dente. It will take 8-10 minutes depending on the squash used and your stove, etc.

recipeInstructions.text: Open the lid and then add in your peppers, Thai basil, sugar, tofu, and mix in. Bring to a good boil.
recipeInstructions.name: Open the lid and then add in your peppers, Thai basil, sugar, tofu, and mix in. Bring to a good boil.

recipeInstructions.text: Taste and adjust salt and flavor. Add more salt if needed. Some lime juice if needed. Then take off heat and serve with some Thai basil on top and more lime juice if needed. Serve with rice or noodles.
recipeInstructions.name: Taste and adjust salt and flavor. Add more salt if needed. Some lime juice if needed. Then take off heat and serve with some Thai basil on top and more lime juice if needed. Serve with rice or noodles.

@graph.keywords: pumpkin curry recipe, Thai curry with pumpkin, vegan pumpkin curry
